snippet: Two deaths at a police station last month have stoked fears that Egypt is not moving beyond its repressive past.
abstract: Killings of two civilians by Egyptian police and other reports of abuse have stoked fears that Egypt's new government, hoping to fill the security vacuum after the 2011 uprising, has been content to bring back an unreformed police force that is continuing old patterns of repression.
lead_paragraph: Two deaths at a police station last month have stoked fears that Egypt is not moving beyond its repressive past.

headline.seo: In New Era, Egyptian Police Mimic the Old, Critics Say
